member.name: T:BCrypt
member.summary: BCrypt implements OpenBSD-style Blowfish password hashing using the scheme described in "A Future-Adaptable Password Scheme" by Niels Provos and David Mazieres.

remarks.para: This password hashing system tries to thwart offline password cracking using a computationally-intensive hashing algorithm, based on Bruce Schneier's Blowfish cipher. The work factor of the algorithm is parametized, so it can be increased as computers get faster.
To hash a password for the first time, call the HashPassword method with a random salt, like this:
To check whether a plaintext password matches one that has been hashed previously, use the CheckPassword method:
The GenerateSalt method takes an optional parameter (logRounds) that determines the computational complexity of the hashing:
remarks.code: string strongSalt = BCrypt.GenerateSalt(10); string strongerSalt = BCrypt.GenerateSalt(12);
remarks.para: The amount of work increases exponentially (2**log_rounds), so each increment is twice as much work. The default log_rounds is 10, and the valid range is 4 to 31.

member.name: M:BCrypt.EncodeBase64(System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Encode a byte array using bcrypt's slightly-modified Base64 encoding scheme. Note that this is _not_ compatible with the standard MIME-Base64 encoding.
member.param: The number of bytes to encode

member.name: M:BCrypt.Char64(System.Char)
member.summary: Look up the 3 bits base64-encoded by the specified character, range-checking against the conversion table.

member.name: M:BCrypt.DecodeBase64(System.String,System.Int32)
member.summary: Decode a string encoded using BCrypt's Base64 scheme to a byte array. Note that this is _not_ compatible with the standard MIME-Base64 encoding.
member.param: The maximum number of bytes to decode
member.returns: An array containing the decoded bytes

member.name: M:BCrypt.Encipher(System.UInt32[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Blowfish encipher a single 64-bit block encoded as two 32-bit halves.
member.param: An array containing the two 32-bit half blocks.
The position in the array of the blocks.

member.name: M:BCrypt.StreamToWord(System.Byte[],System.Int32@)
member.summary: Cycically extract a word of key material.
member.param: The string to extract the data from.
member.returns: The next work of material from data.

member.name: M:BCrypt.InitKey
member.summary: Initialize the Blowfish key schedule.

member.name: M:BCrypt.Key(System.Byte[])
member.summary: Key the Blowfish cipher.

member.name: M:BCrypt.EksKey(System.Byte[],System.Byte[])
member.summary: Perform the "enhanced key schedule" step described by Provos and Mazieres in "A Future-Adaptable Password Scheme" (http://www.openbsd.org/papers/bcrypt-paper.ps).

member.name: M:BCrypt.CryptRaw(System.Byte[],System.Byte[],System.Int32)
member.summary: Perform the central password hashing step in the bcrypt scheme.
member.param: The binary salt to hash with the password.
The binary logarithm of the number of rounds of hashing to apply.
member.returns: An array containing the binary hashed password.

member.name: M:BCrypt.HashPassword(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Hash a password using the OpenBSD bcrypt scheme.
member.param: The salt to hash with (perhaps generated using BCrypt.GenerateSalt).

member.name: M:BCrypt.GenerateSalt(System.Int32)
member.summary: Generate a salt for use with the BCrypt.HashPassword() method.
member.param: The log2 of the number of rounds of hashing to apply. The work factor therefore increases as (2 ** logRounds).

member.name: M:BCrypt.GenerateSalt
member.summary: Generate a salt for use with the BCrypt.HashPassword() method, selecting a reasonable default for the number of hashing rounds to apply.

member.name: M:BCrypt.CheckPassword(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Check that a plaintext password matches a previously hashed one.
member.returns: true if the passwords, false otherwise.

member.summary: Begins the unit of work (transaction)

member.summary: Ends the unit of work (transaction). The default behaviour should be to rollback and close any sessions. Commits should only occur by explicit invocation of Commit()

member.summary: Commits the data changes made in the unit of work (transaction)
